head.title: Docker vs Podman
head.description: Time to think for Docker alternatives since it becomes paid for large enterprises

content.value: Reasons to think out of Docker:

1. Docker becomes paid subscription for large enterprise that has more than 250 employees or $10 million in revenue, starting at $5 per user per month. It is important to notice that Docker Desktop remains free for personal use , educational institutions, non-commercial open-source projects, and small businesses under the new Docker Personal plan.

2. We are using Docker CLI helps to ineract with Docker daemon. Docker daemon is a single process that run forever and that takes care of image and container management. List of few cons in this model:
  • A single process could be a single point of failure.
  • This process will take care of spawning child processes i.e. containers.
  • If failed, then there are orphaned processes.
  • Building containers led to security vulnerabilities.
  • All Docker operations had to be conducted by a user with the same full root authority.

You can find lot of popular alternatives like Podman, Buildah and Skopeo. Each are having own advantages, but here we have choosed podman because of these advantages.
  • You can install Podman instead of Docker. You do not need to start or manage a daemon process like the Docker daemon.
  • The commands you are familiar with in Docker work the same for Podman.
  • Podman stores its containers and images in a different place than Docker.
  • Podman and Docker images are compatible.
  • Podman does more than Docker for Kubernetes environments.

Steps to install Podman

  • brew install podman

  • podman machine init

  • podman machine start

  • echo "alias docker=podman" >> .bashrc

  • Now you can start using the same docker commands.
